memberdef.name: attachTexture

briefdescription.para: Attaches a texture to this FrameBuffer

parameterdescription.para: The framebuffer target. Must be GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_FRAMEBUFFER
Which attachment port to use.
ID for the Texture2D to attach. See Texture2D::getID() const
Mipmap level to attach. Is 0 by default.

briefdescription.para: Attaches a single layer from a texture to this FrameBuffer

parameterdescription.para: The framebuffer target. Must be GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_FRAMEBUFFER
Which attachment port to use.
ID for the Texture2D to attach. See Texture2D::getID() const
Mipmap level to attach. Is 0 by default.
Which layer of the texture to use. It is 0 by default.

memberdef.name: attachRenderbuffer

briefdescription.para: Attaches a RenderBuffer to this FrameBuffer for rendering.

parameterdescription.para: The framebuffer target. Must be GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_FRAMEBUFFER
Which attachment port to use
The RenderBuffer to use.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Specifies what buffers to render to.

detaileddescription.para:
Takes in an array of attachments. A RenderBuffer or Texture2D can be attached to act as a draw sslBuffer.
arrSize
Size of the array of render buffers
buffers
Pointer to the first element of the array
https://www.opengl.org/wiki/GLAPI/glDrawBuffers

memberdef.argsstring: (const int x, const int y, const Size width, const Size height, const Enum format, const Enum type, void *data) const
memberdef.name: readPixels

briefdescription.para: Read pixels from this FrameBuffer

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinate of the lower-left pixel block you want to read. The origin is the lower left corner of the framebuffer
The y-coordinate of the lower-left pixel block you want to read. The origin is the lower left corner of the framebuffer
The width of the pixel block you want to read. A width and height of 1 means a single pixel
The height of the pixel block you want to read. A width and height of 1 means a single pixel
The format of the pixel data. Must be one of GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_STENCIL, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.
The type of the pixel data
Pointer to where you want the data to be written to.

briefdescription.para: Queries OpenGL for the status of this `FrameBuffer.

detaileddescription.para:
Can be used to detect whether thisFrameBuffer` encountered an error during creation.
target
The framebuffer target. Must be GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_FRAMEBUFFER
The FrameBuffer status. The full list of enums is described in the OpenGL specification.
https://www.opengl.org/wiki/GLAPI/glCheckFramebufferStatus
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
GL_INVALID_OPERATION
If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Binds this Object to be used in an OpenGL function.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context
If this Object has not been created yet

briefdescription.para: Unbinds this Object which is equivalent to binding ID 0.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current ID that this Object represents.

detaileddescription.para: The ID is an unsigned number that acts like a pointer to OpenGL memory. It is assigned when Object::init() is called.
If it is 0, the Object is considered uncreated.

When using Object::bind() const it will bind to this ID. Object::unbind() const will bind to ID 0, which is the equivelant of a null pointer.
The ID represented by this Object

briefdescription.para: Compares if 2 Objects are equal.

simplesect.para: Whether this and other are the same

parameterdescription.para: What to compare with

briefdescription.para: Compares if 2 Objects are not equal.

simplesect.para: Whether this and other are different

parameterdescription.para: What to compare with

briefdescription.para: Intended to be overloaded to bind to a certain index.

detaileddescription.para:
Object::bind() const and Object::unbind() const both use this function.
id
Index to bind to. If it is 0, it needs to be unbinded.
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
GL_INVALID_OPERATION
If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context
This should only be used internally or by advanced users. Misuse can cause undefined behavior

briefdescription.para: The ID of this `Object.

detaileddescription.para: ` Should be set in Object::init() and become 0 in Object::destroy()

briefdescription.para: Represents an OpenGL Framebuffer Object which allows rendering to a non-screen location.

detaileddescription.para: This also allows rendering to a Texture2D or RenderBuffer object.
This is not a subclass of the Buffer object as this is technically not an OpenGL sslBuffer. The name is misleading.

xrefdescription.para: target variable which is GL_FRAMEBUFFER by default. and update documentation accordingly
